extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OnaposUI()
      Create the application.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCollection(Collection c)
      Add a collection to the user interface
      void addItemPanel()
      Create the 'add item' panel (so long as it doesn't already exist)
      void deleteCollection(Collection selectedCollection)
      Deletes a collection from both the disk and the UI
      void delItemPanel()
      Remove the 'add item' panel from the screen (if no collection is selected)
      void exit()
      Clean up and close (auto-saving along the way) NOTE: DO NOT CALL THIS FROM ANYWHERE OTHER THAN OnaposWindowListener.windowClosed().
      Collection getSelectedCollection()
      Returns whichever collection is currently selected in the list FIXME: I'm not happy with this code, it relies on 'collections' and 'collectionSelector' being synchronised
      Item getSelectedItem()
      Gets the currently selected item
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Launch the application.
      void populateTable(Collection c)
      Populate the collectionView JTable with items
      void refreshCollectionList()
      This function refreshes the collection list whenever 'collections' is modified TODO: deprecate this (there are more efficient ways to keep them in sync)
      void removeSelectedRow()
      Removes the selected row from the collectionView table, Note that this doesn't actually remove an item from the collection, it's just a helper function to clean up the collectionView table after removing an item.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • addCollection

        public void addCollection(Collection c)
        Add a collection to the user interface

        public void addItemPanel()
        Create the 'add item' panel (so long as it doesn't already exist)

      • getSelectedItem

        public Item getSelectedItem()
        Gets the currently selected item
        Returns:
        the currently selected Item or null if no item is selected

      • removeSelectedRow

        public void removeSelectedRow()
        Removes the selected row from the collectionView table, Note that this doesn't actually remove an item from the collection, it's just a helper function to clean up the collectionView table after removing an item.

      • delItemPanel

        public void delItemPanel()
        Remove the 'add item' panel from the screen (if no collection is selected)

      • populateTable

        public void populateTable(Collection c)
        Populate the collectionView JTable with items
        Parameters:
        c - the collection with which to populate the table

      • getSelectedCollection

        public Collection getSelectedCollection()
        Returns whichever collection is currently selected in the list FIXME: I'm not happy with this code, it relies on 'collections' and 'collectionSelector' being synchronised
        Returns:
        the collection the user has selected in the JList

      • refreshCollectionList

        public void refreshCollectionList()
        This function refreshes the collection list whenever 'collections' is modified TODO: deprecate this (there are more efficient ways to keep them in sync)

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Clean up and close (auto-saving along the way) NOTE: DO NOT CALL THIS FROM ANYWHERE OTHER THAN OnaposWindowListener.windowClosed(). SERIOUSLY. It's supposed to happen whenever the frame is disposed, and not any other place

      • deleteCollection

        public void deleteCollection(Collection selectedCollection)
        Deletes a collection from both the disk and the UI
        Parameters:
        selectedCollection - the collection to delete
